articles.title: Idempotence in System Design: Full example
articles.description: Idempotency in System Design: Full example Idempotency is a concept frequently mentioned in system design. I will explain what it means in simple terms, briefly address common misunderstandings, and finish with a full example. What Is It? Something is idempotent if doing it once or multiple times gi
articles.content: Idempotency in System Design: Full example Idempotency is a concept frequently mentioned in system design. I will explain what it means in simple terms, briefly address common misunderstandings, and finish with a full example. What Is It? Something is idempotent if doing it once or multiple times gives the same outcome. In other words, if I do that something once, I get the same result as when I do it 2 times or 3 times or 10 times. Let's look at the standard example: we have an on and off butto
articles.author: Lukas Niessen

articles.content: On this crisp October morning, it feels like half of the internet is dealing with a hangover. A severe Amazon Web Services outage took out many, many websites, apps, games and other services that rely on Amazon‚Äôs cloud division to stay up and running. That includes a long list of popular software like Venmo, Snapchat, Canva and Fortnite. Even Amazon's own assistant Alexa has been stuttering, and if you're wondering why the internet seems to be against you today ‚Äî you're not imagining

articles.content: There's yet another streaming bundle in town, and it will be ideal for fans of Ted Lasso and The Office . Apple and NBC have teamed up to provide both of their streaming services together in a bundle starting at $15 per month. The new Apple TV + Peacock bundle is officially available now for $15 monthly for the ad-supported tier. This is a mighty fine deal, given that Apple TV recently changed both its name and price . The platform costs $13 per month now on its own. Peacock starts at $11 per mo

articles.description: In many web applications ‚Äî support systems, lead management, code reviews, or on-call rotations ‚Äî there‚Äôs a recurring need to assign work evenly across a group of people. I built round_robin_assignment to solve that problem in a clean, persistent, and concurrency-safe way for Ruby on Rails projects.
articles.content: In many web applications ‚Äî support systems, lead management, code reviews, or on-call rotations ‚Äî there‚Äôs a recurring need to assign work evenly across a group of people. I built round_robin_assignment to solve that problem in a clean, persistent, and concurrency-safe way for Ruby on Rails projects. This gem encapsulates a database-backed round-robin assignment algorithm that works across multiple app instances and survives restarts ‚Äî no more reinventing the wheel for fair task rotation. üöÄ Why

Both apps have already been removed from the Microsoft Store and Mac App Store, and existing users are starting to get notifications that the desktop apps will disappear fully in December. A Meta support page,
articles.content: Meta is getting ready to pull support for its desktop Messenger apps on Windows and macOS. Both apps have already been removed from the Microsoft Store and Mac App Store, and existing users are starting to get notifications that the desktop apps will disappear fully in December. A Meta support page, first spotted by Apple Insider , reveals that Mac Messenger app users will have 60 days to use the app before it‚Äôs fully deprecated, and then a block will be put in place. articles.author: Tom Warren

articles.content: Today‚Äôs Decoder episode is a special one: I‚Äôm talking to Zocdoc CEO Oliver Kharraz, and we chatted live onstage at the TechFutures conference here in New York City. Johnston is the founder of The Midas Project: a nonprofit that monitors the practices of "leading AI companies to ensure transparency, privac
articles.content: On August 19th at 7:07PM, Tyler Johnston received a message from his roommate. A man, the text said, was knocking on their door with legal documents to serve. Johnston is the founder of The Midas Project: a nonprofit that monitors the practices of "leading AI companies to ensure transparency, privacy, and ethical standards are maintained." At the time, he was also the sole full-time employee. The Midas Project is behind The OpenAI Files , a 50-page report about OpenAI's evolution from under-the-
articles.author: Hayden Field

articles.content: Science Corporation‚Äîa competitor to Neuralink founded by the former president of Elon Musk’s brain-interface venture‚Äîhas leapfrogged its rival after acquiring a vision implant that’s in advanced testing, for a fire-sale price. The implant produces a form of ‚Äúartificial vision‚Äù that lets some patients read text and do crosswords, according to a report published in The New England Journal of Medicine today . The implant is a microelectronic chip placed under the retina. Using signals f
articles.author: Antonio Regalado

articles.title: AI could predict who will have a heart attack
articles.description: For all the modern marvels of cardiology, we struggle to predict who will have a heart attack. Many people never get screened at all. Now, startups like Bunkerhill Health, Nanox.AI, and HeartLung Technologies are applying AI algorithms to screen millions of CT scans for early signs of heart disease.
articles.content: For all the modern marvels of cardiology, we struggle to predict who will have a heart attack. Many people never get screened at all. Now, startups like Bunkerhill Health , Nanox.AI , and HeartLung Technologies are applying AI algorithms to screen millions of CT scans for early signs of heart disease. This technology could be a breakthrough for public health, applying an old tool to uncover patients whose high risk for a heart attack is hiding in plain sight. But it remains unproven at scale whi
articles.author: Vishal Khetpal

articles.title: Should an AI copy of you help decide if you live or die?
articles.description: Doctors share top concerns of AI surrogates aiding life-or-death decisions.
articles.content: For more than a decade, researchers have wondered whether artificial intelligence could help predict what incapacitated patients might want when doctors must make life-or-death decisions on their behalf. It remains one of the most high-stakes questions in health care AI today. But as AI improves, some experts increasingly see it as inevitable that digital ‚Äúclones‚Äù of patients could one day aid family members, doctors, and ethics boards in making end-of-life decisions that are aligned with a pati
articles.author: Ashley Belanger
